by Laurence Moroney

![](images/2-01.png){width="365"}

::: {#3eb3a56c .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np
from tensorflow import keras

print(tf.__version__)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
2.16.1
```
:::
:::


::: {#b9c7e1aa .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Build a simple Sequential model
model = tf.keras.Sequential([keras.layers.Dense(units=1, input_shape=[1])])
```
:::


::: {#927c20e2 .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Compile the model
model.compile(optimizer='sgd', loss='mean_squared_error')
```
:::


::: {#0830f9cd .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Declare model inputs and outputs for training
xs = np.array([-1.0,  0.0, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0], dtype=float)
ys = np.array([-3.0, -1.0, 1.0, 3.0, 5.0, 7.0], dtype=float)
```
:::


::: {#05975c69 .cell execution_count=5}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Train the model
model.fit(xs, ys, epochs=500,verbose=0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5}
```
<keras.src.callbacks.history.History at 0x2848f63d0>
```
:::
:::


::: {#3a449677 .cell execution_count=6}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Make a prediction
print(model.predict(x=np.array([10.0])))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
1/1 ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ 0s 13ms/step                                     1/1 ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ 0s 13ms/step
[[18.976614]]
```
:::
